channel.title: Digital Garden, again on
channel.description: Recent content in Digital Garden, again on

item.description: What you’re reading here is not a blog, it’s a “digital garden”. It consists of posts like blog, but they can grow, like plants.

Install argocd-autopilot on raspi k3s Create blank git repo e.g. https://github.com/narze/home-cluster Create Github Personal Access Token https://github.com/settings/tokens/new Install argocd-autopilot brew install argocd-autopilot 1 2 3 4 export GIT_TOKEN=your_github_pat export GIT_REPO=https://github.
Test link to upper level pages like Ideas or another folders like

item.title: 100 Days of Writing
item.description: I’ve been thinking of this challenge while I was doing #100DaysOfCode. As I want to be a better writer/blogger as well.

item.title: 40% Keyboard
item.description: Some people has seen me using Planck Keyboard. In fact, I’ve 3 of them. The keyboard form factor is called “40%” which has only 4 rows and does not have function row or number row.

item.title: Amazon SES Setup
item.description: Create new domain identity to be able to send emails. Create new test email identity to be able to receive test emails.

item.title: asdf - The Ultimate Version Manager
item.description: Due to the differences of the dependencies of your projects (and others on GitHub.) Now it’s pretty normal to have multiple versions of programming languages like Python, Node.

item.title: Atomic Habits
item.description: Tiny changes make a big difference 1% worse every day for one year = 0.03 1% better every day for one year = 37.

item.title: Books
item.description: I like to read productivity-related (some are “self-help”) books. Recently I started reading science fiction as well. I often read on my Onyx Boox Nova using Kindle app or PDF reader app.

item.title: Chaining GraphQL queries
item.description: (ref: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/49317582/how-to-chain-two-graphql-queries-in-sequence-using-apollo-client/49320606#49320606) The props added by your firstQuery component will be available to the component below (inside) it, so you can do something like:

item.title: Colemak Mod-DHm
item.description: After 7 years of switching to Colemak keyboard layout, I decided to move on to a new layout. I have seen Mod-DH for quite a while.

item.title: Command Line Aliases
item.description: I extensively use command line to navigate stuff and run commands, so I keep track of commands I ran often, then make aliases to reduce them

item.title: Create, review, and merge GitHub Pull Requests from command line only
item.description: Now you can manage all the GitHub pull request workflows from using only the command line via it’s [official CLI][1]. Use homebrew command to install on macOS.

item.title: Debug-less development
item.description: Debug-less Development Are you using console.log all the time when you create websites? Are you adding breakpoints in every if-else blocks in IDE?

item.title: Digital Detox
item.description: Every once in a while, I slipped into the world full of distractions, named the Internet. Like everyone does, I take hours viewing Youtube videos, scroll through Facebook posts, reading Tweets, and so on.

item.title: Dynamic Programming
item.description: Links https://learnxinyminutes.com/docs/dynamic-programming/

item.title: Generating an optimized Thai keyboard layout
item.description: I built a new Thai keyboard layout called Manoonchai Preparation Since I’ll use Rust for this project and I’m relatively new to this language, I’ll start from gathering the corpus from various sources and find out the most frequently used keys are.

item.title: Ideas
item.description: On what I would do here Fix image Blog entry about setting this site up, maybe should be on Medium?

item.description: https://www.microservice-api-patterns.org www.youtube.com/watch?v=cNp7ys0g0Bs

item.title: Multiple Computers
item.description: Benefits from having multiple computers To be clear, this doesn’t mean to using multiple computers at the same time. In this context is to having multiple instances of similar computers at more than one place like your home, your office, in the cloud, etc.

item.title: Quartz
item.description: The [[Digital Garden]] engine behind https://garden.narze.live : https://quartz.jzhao.xyz Upgrading Quartz git remote add upstream git@github.com:jackyzha0/quartz.git git fetch upstream git checkout upstream/hugo -- layouts .

item.title: Quine
item.description: 1 eval s="puts'eval s='+s.inspect"

item.title: Relentless - Tim Grover
item.description: Tim classifies people into 3 groups: Cooler, Closer, and Cleaner. Then focus on what Cleaner thinks and does to achieve successful career, like Micheal Jordan, Kobe Bryant, and Dwyane Wade for instance.

item.title: Ryzen Hackintosh Specs Research
item.description: November 28, 2020 - https://notebookspec.com/pc/8175463 December 1, 2020 - https://notebookspec.com/pc/8184920 December 10, 2020 - https://notebookspec.com/pc/8209709 Geekbench Old hackintosh : 800/2850 Current macbook (mid 2019) : 900/3350 5600x : 1500/7500 5800x : 1500/8000-13000 5900x : 1500/12000-16000 https://dortania.

item.title: Second Brain
item.description: Second Brain A term coined by Tiago Forte. It’s about capturing everything in a system to reduce information overload. He also created PARA Method.

item.title: TailwindCSS
item.description: TailwindCSS is my favorite CSS framework right now. But for common elements like buttons or input forms I use DaisyUI as a component framework which extends TailwindCSS to get the job done.

item.title: The Three-Body Problem - Cixin Liu
item.description: A chinese SF novel about (no-spoilers) Chinese history in time of Cultural Revolution, an astrophysicist, a Virtual Reality game, and how they related to some weird phenomenon from unknown source.

item.title: Typing Guide
item.description: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1L-P68VDSGlpLM5A9tfRvWFohaR2NzPbkUT0ok34rsFU/edit Practice regularly, take breaks Have good posture “Typing is 99% Muscle Memory” Type before going to bed, have a regular sleep cycle Accuracy First Rhythm Go faster on easy words, slower on hard words Slow down on any words longer than 7 letters or shorter than 3 Read one word ahead Read entire words, not single characters Advanced tricks Use right thumb to press n,m,b (h,k,v an Colemak DH) and sometimes comma Control + Backspace to correct wrong words Improve your reading speed Notice weakness and fix it Alternating between focusing on speed and accuracy

item.title: Uses
item.description: Everything I use. Migrated from https://monosor.com/uses Coding Dash - Offline code & API documentation Kitty Fantasque Sans Mono ( Nerdfont patched) & IBM Plex Sans Thai Visual Studio Code with Aura Dark theme Languages & Frameworks Svelte Ruby & Ruby on Rails Javascript & Node.

item.title: ปรัชญาของ IO
item.description: รู้ก่อน (See First) ตัดสินใจก่อน (Decide First) ปฏิบัติก่อน (Act First) และปฏิบัติอย่างมีประสิทธิผลกว่า (Act more effectively) จนสามารถเอาชนะความเชื่อและศรัทธา (Heart and Mind)
